{"aid": "http://arxiv.org/abs/2504.21678v1", "title": "Reflections and Drinfeld twists for set-theoretic Yang-Baxter maps", "summary": "We prove that reflections, for a solution to the set-theoretic Yang-Baxter
equation, provide Drinfeld twists in the sense of Kulish and Mudrov. Using De
Commer's notion of a braided action, we then define group reflections for a
braided group, and prove that they provide group Drinfeld twists in the sense
of Ghobadi. Finally, we characterise when a reflection on a solution (X,r) can
be extended to a group reflection on the structure group G(X,r).", "main_category": "math.QA", "categories": "math.QA", "published": "2025-04-30T14:17:47Z"}
